properties.headline: Avalanche Warning issued January 14 at 6:32AM MST by NWS Pocatello ID
properties.description:
THE FOLLOWING MESSAGE IS TRANSMITTED AT THE REQUEST OF THE FOREST
SERVICE UTAH AVALANCHE CENTER.

THE FOREST SERVICE UTAH AVALANCHE CENTER IN SALT LAKE CITY HAS
ISSUED A BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WARNING.

* TIMING...IN EFFECT FROM 600 AM MST THIS MORNING UNTIL 600 AM MST
WEDNESDAY MORNING.

* AFFECTED AREA...THE BEAR RIVER RANGE IN SOUTHEAST IDAHO.

* AVALANCHE DANGER...THE AVALANCHE DANGER FOR THE WARNING AREA IS
HIGH WITH VERY DANGEROUS AVALANCHE CONDITIONS ON DRIFTED UPPER
ELEVATION SLOPES.

* REASON/IMPACTS...RECENT HEAVY SNOW AND DRIFTING FROM STRONG WEST
WINDS HAVE CREATED AREAS OF UNSTABLE SNOW ON UPPER ELEVATION
SLOPES. BOTH HUMAN TRIGGERED AND NATURAL AVALANCHES ARE LIKELY.
AVOID TRAVEL IN AVALANCHE TERRAIN. STAY OFF OF AND OUT FROM
UNDER SLOPES STEEPER THAN 30 DEGREES.
properties.instruction:
BACKCOUNTRY TRAVELERS SHOULD STAY OFF OF...AND OUT FROM
UNDERNEATH...SLOPES STEEPER THAN 30 DEGREES.

AVALANCHES MAY RUN LONG DISTANCES AND CAN RUN INTO MATURE
FORESTS. CHOOSE CONSERVATIVE TERRAIN.

CONSULT WWW.UTAHAVALANCHECENTER.ORG OR CALL 1-888-999-4019 FOR
MORE DETAILED INFORMATION.

SIMILAR AVALANCHE DANGER MAY EXIST AT LOCATIONS OUTSIDE THE
COVERAGE AREA OF THIS OR ANY AVALANCHE CENTER.
